//: Generated by fleet-terraform-generator - DO NOT EDIT

batch_size.description: Batch size for the response of the Qualys Server API. This parameter specifies the truncation limit for the response. Specify 0 for no truncation limit.

cloud_data.description: What source to use to populate `cloud.*` fields.

enable_deduplication.description:
By default, each sync interval will ingest all detected vulnerabilities. 
However, if deduplication is enabled, any existing vulnerabilities in the current backing index will not be duplicated. 
The presence of a vulnerability in the backing index is determined by computing a checksum of the event contents and checking if that checksum already exists in Elasticsearch.

enable_request_tracer.description: The request tracer logs requests and responses to the agent's local file-system for debugging configurations. Enabling this request tracing compromises security and should only be used for debugging. Disabling the request tracer will delete any stored traces. See [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filebeat-input-cel.html#_resource_tracer_enable) for details.

fleet_agent_policy_id.description: Agent policy ID to add the package policy to.

fleet_data_stream_namespace.description: Namespace to use for the data stream.

fleet_package_policy_description.description: Description to use for the package policy.

fleet_package_policy_name_suffix.description: Suffix to append to the end of the package policy name.

fleet_package_version.description: Version of the qualys_vmdr package to use.

http_client_timeout.description: Duration before declaring that the HTTP client connection has timed out. Give a timeout of more than 1 minute when retrieving data which is more than 15 days old. Supported time units are ns, us, ms, s, m, h. Requests may take significant time, so short timeouts are not recommended.

input_parameters.description: Input Parameters for the URL. param1=value&param2=value&param3=....*

interval.description: Interval between two REST API calls. User can choose interval as per their plan mentioned in [Qualys API Limits](https://www.qualys.com/docs/qualys-api-limits.pdf). Supported units for this parameter are h/m/s.

preserve_duplicate_custom_fields.description: Preserve qualys_vmdr.asset_host_detection fields that were copied to Elastic Common Schema (ECS) fields.

preserve_original_event.description: Preserves a raw copy of the original event, added to the field `event.original`.

processors_yaml.description: Processors are used to reduce the number of fields in the exported event or to enhance the event with metadata. This executes in the agent before the data is parsed. See [Processors](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filtering-and-enhancing-data.html) for details.

proxy_url.description: URL to proxy connections in the form of http[s]://<user>:<password>@<server name/ip>:<port>. Please ensure your username and password are in URL encoded format.

show_igs.description: By default, Qualys API only includes detection records with `Confirmed` and `Potential` vulnerabilities. When this option is enabled, the Qualys API sends detections of type `Info` in addition to `Confirmed` and `Potential` vulnerabilities.

ssl_yaml.description: SSL configuration options. See [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/configuration-ssl.html#ssl-common-config) for details.

url.description: Base URL of the Qualys Server API.

  batch_size = var.batch_size
  cloud_data = var.cloud_data
  enable_deduplication = var.enable_deduplication
  enable_request_tracer = var.enable_request_tracer

  input_parameters = var.input_parameters
  interval = var.interval
  preserve_duplicate_custom_fields = var.preserve_duplicate_custom_fields
  preserve_original_event = var.preserve_original_event
  processors = var.processors_yaml
  show_igs = var.show_igs
  tags = var.tags

})}
